1058357821996232706.text: Happy anniversary @Space_Station! In honor of the #SpaceStation20th, we're highlighting spinoffs from our favorite orbiting lab. 1123300995822309378.text: The @Space_Station is designed to provide life support for its human crew members so they can complete their mission of research and exploration. Do you know the name of the chemical process that is harnessed to generate oxygen for the crew members to breathe?pic.twitter.com/CIvEPM6mCn

1102201607717089281.text: A new generation of space flight starts now with the arrival of @SpaceX’s Crew Dragon to the @Space_Station. Congratulations to all for this historic achievement getting us closer to flying American Astronauts on American rockets. #LaunchAmericapic.twitter.com/QMOuE2ecwm

1118941289595199490.text: Taking @Space_Station’s robotic arm for a spin! Tomorrow, @AstroAnnimal will capture the Cygnus cargo vehicle using the CanadaArm2 as Cygnus holds position just 30ft from station. We all got a turn practicing on the real robotic arm for the first time to prep for the big arrival!pic.twitter.com/KMkSKztFa5

1119663495983915013.text: We can’t do physiological experiments w/o samples, this week  I collected urine, saliva, blood & more. These experiments teach us about immune function in space and are critical for extending our stays. Tables have turned as I’m now the subject instead of the experimenter!pic.twitter.com/CpWW5kQux6 – at NASA Johnson Space Center

1064525042208395264.text: Captured Cygnus today with @Astro_Alex…Proud to have The SS John Young on-board!pic.twitter.com/hopvt2r54E

1064937456330571781.text: Happy Birthday, @Space_Station! Bittersweet final moment in the cupola before returning to Earth after my #yearinspace. Having spent 500 days of my life on ISS, I’m inspired if we can do this—the hardest thing we’ve ever done—we can do anything if we choose to & we work together.pic.twitter.com/I8I6HUinyx

1069610961986772993.text: Technology to make routine refueling of vehicles and satellites in space a reality will be tested on the @Space_Station when the Robotic Refueling Mission 3 experiment arrives on the next @SpaceX #Dragon, scheduled to launch on Dec. 4th! https://go.nasa.gov/2TRnoAR pic.twitter.com/dijo7ypfdD

1113809497905143808.text:
CONTACT and CAPTURE! 

The #ProgressMS11 spacecraft successfully docked with the International @Space_Station. The cargo spacecraft delivered to the ISS over two tons of cargo, including fuel, air, equipment for maintaining the station in working order.pic.twitter.com/hoGIn8R8jP

1121180212752994305.text: Runner’s high! Yesterday our treadmill finally called it quits after outlasting its expected lifetime by years. 1118524007089954816.text: Will 2019 be a big year for the 2013 astronaut class? Signs point to yes. Congratulations to my 8ball classmates on their recent mission assignments! Nicknamed the "Teacup," this object is about 1.1 billion light years away. The "handle" is a ring of optical and X-ray light, while the "cup" is a black hole known as a quasar. Details: https://go.nasa.gov/2TTsmQu pic.twitter.com/6FpH4o0E4j

1115957711521439746.text: Hearing about #BlackHoles this morning? Here's a refresher on what a black hole IS.  It's a place where a large amount of mass has been squeezed into a tiny space. 1100214367902142464.text: Thank you, Moon!  Our home planet’s signature 23.5-degree tilt on its axis is due to the Moon keeping it in check. Here are even more discoveries we’ve learned about Earth by studying our closest neighbor: https://go.nasa.gov/2Thlg8b pic.twitter.com/2FUThpDH30

1109951132699422722.text: Our @Commercial_Crew Program is set to return to our nation the capability to fly @NASA_Astronauts to the @Space_Station. Curious to learn how @SpaceX's #CrewDragon flight test recently made history for the program? Here are the highlights: https://go.nasa.gov/2FoKJUk pic.twitter.com/H1Pd4lVoVm

1120137902082494464.text: Stop to smell the roses ... and then take a picture! This #EarthDay while we're showing the love for our planet, we want to share photos taken by you! Snap your best close-up using #PictureEarth & see how your can be featured: https://go.nasa.gov/2UKAWCg pic.twitter.com/0S7LNcnlop

1105257109812400128.text:
We are going forward to the Moon by pushing science into the next generation. By studying lunar samples, we are discovering new resources like drinking water, oxygen and fuel. Learn about worlds beyond our own in pursuit of #Moon2Mars:
https://go.nasa.gov/2J4duKZ pic.twitter.com/8lsb1z8j2j

1105302897351409665.text:
Why are we returning humans to the Moon? How will we get there — to stay? 

From new partnerships with U.S. companies, to the first @NASA_SLS + @NASA_Orion flights, to the Gateway, to landing on the Moon's surface: our new website covers #Moon2Mars 101: https://go.nasa.gov/2J3bFh9 pic.twitter.com/d26yzRwj4c

1109061490101899266.text: During today's spacewalk, we'll be taking questions about our @NASA_Astronauts' excursion outside of the @Space_Station. Ask questions using #AskNASA and tune in to watch!https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1MnxnNMlgYYxO …

1121246120448020481.text: Thanks to our @NASAHubble Space Telescope’s five servicing missions and 29 years in space, our view of the universe and our place within it has never been the same. Take a look in this @Twitter moment:https://twitter.com/i/moments/1121150886330470400 …

1112373010789478401.text:
Take a trip to the center of the Milky Way in a new 360° immersive visualization. Your vantage point? The galaxy's central supermassive black hole!  

This visualization combines @NASAAmes supercomputer simulations & @chandraxray data. Click through: https://go.nasa.gov/2FCzAze pic.twitter.com/DOQc9XzfDz

1114948399659405315.text: From @Space_Station, an astronaut captured this image of the snowy peaks and valleys of Central Asia's Tien Shan mountains and the Taklimakan desert. Ice from the mountain glaciers melts in springtime, providing the area with fresh water. Look closer: https://go.nasa.gov/2UmCFhb pic.twitter.com/6vVnO5znTp

1106943469073956864.text: What plans are you cooking up for your weekend? Well, we’re cooking up an alien atmosphere right here on Earth. In a @NASAJPL study, we are heating mixtures of hydrogen and carbon monoxide to simulate atmospheric conditions on exoplanets. Learn more: https://go.nasa.gov/2TS44Gu pic.twitter.com/ONf9S3rIqg

1101151296474763264.text: The first-ever launch of the @SpaceX #CrewDragon is less than 2 days from now! Watch a live briefing on this demo mission from @NASAKennedy and send your #askNASA questions: https://go.nasa.gov/2Thgurn pic.twitter.com/iSbqqqz7Ht

1106362485966139392.text: Welcome to the @Space_Station! The Soyuz spacecraft carrying @AstroHague, @Astro_Christina & cosmonaut Alexey Ovchinin docked to our orbiting laboratory at 9:01pm ET while flying about 250 miles over the Pacific Ocean just west of Peru. Watch: http://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/fGcu2gVF6E

1111576368213622786.text: LIVE SPACEWALK: @AstroHague and @Astro_Christina venture outside the International @Space_Station for about 6.5 hours on the second of three back-to-back spacewalks. Watch live coverage:https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1gqxvnjYpBBxB …

1110673481488916485.text: We will go forward to the Moon with world-class propulsion systems, and unparalleled spacecraft precision. @NASA_technology drives exploration and we are dedicated to build a sustainable presence on the lunar surface. Join us as we forge ahead: https://go.nasa.gov/2Fva1A3 pic.twitter.com/os7HMSbiZQ

1110609757549715456.text: During today's National Space Council meeting, Administrator @JimBridenstine says that he is confident we can have the first @NASA_SLS launch in 2020 and fly the @NASA_Orion crew capsule around the Moon. Watch: http://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/fUWZg2fUbc

1112017692452626433.text:
This week: 

 We're accelerating our return to the Moon
 Two @NASA_Astronauts went on a spacewalk
 We tested our #Marscopter for its trip to the Red Planet

For all of these stories and more, visit: https://go.nasa.gov/2U9KyWX .pic.twitter.com/zKlzoq0w47

1101935712105099267.text: Some assembly required! @Space_Station astronauts @AstroAnnimal & @Astro_DavidS are piecing together Robotic Refueling tools to transfer super-cold liquids for life support systems. One step closer to sending humans to the Moon, Mars & beyond! Details: https://go.nasa.gov/2IMJIKC pic.twitter.com/GUGrEKgOUQ

1110592508755501057.text: Joined by Apollo 11 astronaut @TheRealBuzz at today's National Space Council Meeting, @VP talks about our next giant leap to return @NASA_Astronauts to the Moon and develop technology to go to Mars and worlds beyond. Watch: http://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/o8sgPtVM6h

1115961830390882304.text: History is being made! A global network of telescopes has been working to capture the first ever image of a black hole. Follow along as @NSF shares the groundbreaking result at 9am ET of the #EHTBlackHole. Tune in: https://www.nsf.gov/blackholes https://twitter.com/NSF/status/1115956593487749120 …

1100175223633166336.text: From the vantage point of the @Space_Station, we will study space weather! Our new mission will help scientists understand and, ultimately, forecast the vast space weather system around our home planet. Here’s how: https://go.nasa.gov/2Tc5pYz pic.twitter.com/c3UzuCeQc7

1101958362584023043.text: What’s better than bubbles? Superbubbles in space! @chandraxray data combines w/ @NASAHubble optical data to reveal a pair of balloon-like regions in a galaxy 67 million light yrs from Earth. Learn about superbubbles' possible connection to cosmic rays: https://go.nasa.gov/2IKF5Ra pic.twitter.com/mOwzchlG6F

1113982743078154243.text:
This March, our @MarsCuriosity rover saw not one but two solar eclipses, by two different moons! 

The views it captured of tiny Deimos and larger Phobos (seen here) will be used to better understand the moons' orbits. Click through for more: https://go.nasa.gov/2Umun97 pic.twitter.com/8SI6cE5FQi

1097871237555126273.text: We are saddened by the loss of visionary storyteller & @IMAX filmmaker Toni Myers, who gave audiences a front row to the wonders of the cosmos. Watch Toni talk about her work training @NASA_Astronauts to film life off the Earth and on the @Space_Station: https://go.nasa.gov/2T0DLO2 pic.twitter.com/VB3MJSKwks

1110612961406545920.text: The Gateway around the Moon will allow us to get to more parts of the lunar surface than ever before, says @JimBridenstine during today's National Space Council meeting. Watch to learn about our plans to have boots on the Moon in the upcoming years: http://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/9GGjehuf2h

1104832800421756935.text: A long, brown oval known as a "brown barge" is prominently seen within a polar jet stream along the southern edge of Jupiter's north polar region. Seen in this Feb. 12 view by @NASAJuno, it was taken about 5,000 miles from the planet's cloud tops. Look: https://go.nasa.gov/2J4lQlT pic.twitter.com/rJwND5P2Z8

1118294283692466177.text: Our @CassiniSaturn spacecraft gathered radar data on its final flyby of Saturn's largest moon in 2017, revealing that the small liquid lakes in Titan's northern hemisphere are surprisingly deep, perched atop hills and filled with methane. Learn more: https://go.nasa.gov/2UDFBGd pic.twitter.com/tvrLLXHcWK

1103020394938798084.text:
How much does galactic wind weigh? 

With @SOFIAtelescope, researchers found the Cigar Galaxy's galactic wind weighs a lot: the mass of 50-60 million Suns! Aligned along a magnetic field, the wind carries gas and dust into intergalactic space. More: https://go.nasa.gov/2ISXX0s pic.twitter.com/UX7oOT66w6

1105291066935250945.text: Our science, technology and human exploration activities touch every aspect of our lives here on Earth, and we want to extend human presence in the solar system. Learn how we will explore #Moon2Mars in this @Twitter moment:https://go.nasa.gov/2J5XQyL

1108804158596042753.text:
Ready. Set. Spacewalk. 

Two @NASA_Astronauts are checking their spacesuits today and reviewing procedures one final time before tomorrow’s spacewalk. Find out more details about their planned 6.5 hours in the vacuum of space: https://go.nasa.gov/2HKmGSt pic.twitter.com/G91Tc0EXx4

1099870490200604674.text:
Congratulations to @FirstManMovie on your visual effects #Oscars win. As we celebrate the #Apollo50th anniversary this year, see how the historic Moon mission hit the big screen: https://youtu.be/VTFHiRbOFkU 
Learn more about the #Apollo50th anniversary: https://www.nasa.gov/specials/apollo50th/ …pic.twitter.com/1BwLUDaWsd

1111086829904805888.text: As we prepare to send astronauts and spacecraft long distances through space, scientists are keeping an eye on the weather. SPACE WEATHER!  Get an update on the forecast by watching the latest episode of @NASAScienceCast https://go.nasa.gov/2TZTaiR pic.twitter.com/yAkVaBC3Ey

1115657234162147328.text: Why the Moon? "The Moon is a proving ground…it the best place for us to live and work on another world for us to ultimately go to Mars," says @JimBridenstine during his #Moon2024 keynote at #35Space #SpaceSymposiumpic.twitter.com/omc4ZggNpS

1107100864039264257.text:
How are stars and planets born? What happens to its planets when a star dies?

Come along on an epic interstellar journey, billions of years long, through the life and death of a planetary system: https://go.nasa.gov/2TMRdpf pic.twitter.com/lrvowxN4dd

1116084736399687680.text: Bullseye  For the 1st time, two of our CubeSats created a laser link in space! Their result lays the path forward for creating a constellation of small satellites, working together to transfer more data in orbit around the Earth and Moon. Check it out: https://go.nasa.gov/2G2LQcC pic.twitter.com/zReWORUCKh

1097890940772065280.text: Scientists who study the solar system tend to ask big questions: How was our solar system formed? Where did the building blocks of life come from? To find answers, they’re looking more and more at small worlds. @NASAScienceCast explains why: https://go.nasa.gov/2IpWNJz pic.twitter.com/pOTfhk07GQ

1115631745389481984.text:
At 11:45 a.m. EDT: Don't miss Administrator @JimBridenstine talk about our exciting #Moon2024 plans at the #35Space #SpaceSymposium. Learn how we plan to land astronauts on the lunar South Pole within 5 years: https://go.nasa.gov/2FYrQru 

Watch live: https://go.nasa.gov/2G09aaR pic.twitter.com/okm7YzmngT

1117141152489181184.text: From sky gazing as child to flying on 3 space shuttle missions, @JanetKavandi never doubted her ability to achieve high goals. 1111290477926645761.text: It is baseball's #OpeningDay! Here are views of @MLB stadiums and their host cities as captured by our @NASA_Astronauts on the International @Space_Station, located 250 miles above Earth. Check out this unique perspective:pic.twitter.com/S7sHHp7Pkb

1102361017810604032.text: In blue and green, the freshwater Menindee Lakes stand out in this @NASAEarth satellite image of New South Wales, Australia. But they're drying up from high temps and low precipitation. The effects of extreme drought: https://go.nasa.gov/2IPSDe7 pic.twitter.com/wWfUIFa4Vx

1119775512816234497.text: An astronaut aboard the @Space_Station snapped this image of the South Indian Ocean as the station flew 265 miles above the clouds. The off-world laboratory orbits the Earth about every 90 minutes & helps us prepare for deep space exploration. Gaze in awe: https://go.nasa.gov/2ULY2st pic.twitter.com/1sTV8vNYeG

1108457501559795712.text: Nearly 50 years ago, we conquered all odds by planting humankind's first steps on surface of the Moon. With tonight’s #supermoon, we celebrate #Apollo50th & look to the skies in awe once again. Watch the latest episode of @NASAScienceCast for more: https://go.nasa.gov/2HP9TOq pic.twitter.com/JGRajDMwEA

1115287221572182016.text: What's happening in space right now? Two @NASA_Astronauts are currently working *outside* the @Space_Station. Watch live coverage as @AstroAnnimal and @Astro_DavidS perform their tasks during today's 6.5 hour spacewalk:https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1BdxYAljWoYxX …

1119194182890008579.text: LIVE NOW: Installation of @NorthropGrumman's #Cygnus  to @Space_Station. What's on board? 1109637208053551104.text: Passionate about the world of astronomy? Apply to go behind the scenes of @SOFIAtelescope, the world’s largest flying telescope, during an April #NASASocial event in California where you'll meet researchers exploring the cosmos from 40,000 feet! Details: https://go.nasa.gov/2Fwdn7b pic.twitter.com/uZ9kCtxapL

1102153634370981888.text: Crew members living and working aboard the @Space_Station are monitoring the approach of @SpaceX’s #CrewDragon spacecraft. Tune in: https://www.nasa.gov/nasalive https://twitter.com/AstroAnnimal/status/1101949558509223936 …

1106608929679790081.text: In a space agency filled with trailblazers, women play a vital role shaping how we explore our home planet & the universe. In honor of #WomensHistoryMonth, join #WomenatNASA on @Reddit at 2pm ET to ask anything about careers & our mission of exploration: https://go.nasa.gov/2W5XWbj pic.twitter.com/PVd8tkr1VC

1115973963358834689.text: In a historic feat by @EHTelescope & @NSF, a black hole image has been captured for the 1st time. Several of our missions observed the same black hole using different light wavelengths and collected data to understand the black hole's environment. Details: https://go.nasa.gov/2Uwj1PF pic.twitter.com/4PhH1bfHxc

1122608935477891074.text: Is it spring yet? An astronaut aboard @Space_Station captured this still-frozen scene of the southern tip of Hudson Bay in Canada on April 22. The layers of sea ice will thaw as warmer weather arrives — usually leaving the area ice-free by August: https://go.nasa.gov/2V6GLdL pic.twitter.com/6wZdIRFP50

1108417449114943489.text: Today at 1:50pm ET, we're cranking up the heat on @NASA_Orion’s Launch Abort System Attitude Control Motor.  Join us for a live broadcast of the spacecraft’s hot fire test at @NorthropGrumman’s Elkton, MD facility. Tune in at https://go.nasa.gov/2FqYcfq  and ask ?s using #AskNASApic.twitter.com/DQimthUjS8

1115805858687008768.text:
"Keep eating your fruits and veggies."      It's good advice on Earth and in space! 

In the latest Sciencecast, learn how spaceflight affects astronauts' nutritional needs and how we ensure they have a healthy diet on long duration missions: https://go.nasa.gov/2UrufVQ pic.twitter.com/DbtJKtg0w0

1101225658963902464.text:
LIVE NOW: The pre-launch briefing ahead of the March 2, 2:49am ET liftoff of #CrewDragon begins. Gathered @NASAKennedy are representatives from @Commercial_Crew, @Space_Station and @SpaceX to answer all your pre-launch ?s. 

Use #askNASA & tune in here: https://go.nasa.gov/2TmxMTS pic.twitter.com/pvIIMNj0r7

1103454794839195648.text: Time flies when you’re exploring deep space.  Ten years ago, we launched our 1st planet hunter, @NASAKepler, that collected data revealing our night sky to be filled with billions of hidden planets – more planets even than stars. Details: https://go.nasa.gov/2IYNBvW pic.twitter.com/jtiHUV1uIJ

1111595579128336384.text: At 7:42am ET, the #spacewalk has officially begun as the astronauts set their spacesuits to battery power, marking the beginning of a 6.5 hour spacewalk to upgrade the International @Space_Station's power storage capacity. Watch live coverage:https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1gqxvnjYpBBxB …

1102620727210098689.text: The crew aboard the @Space_Station is about to double in size!  On March 14, astronauts @Astro_Christina and @AstroHague and Cosmonaut Alexey Ovchinin will launch  for a six-and-a-half month mission in space. Take a look at their final preparations: https://go.nasa.gov/2J5kzLt pic.twitter.com/wPIIHqib9m

1099856260382556160.text:
Sat., March 2, 2:48am ET : Set your alarm & don't miss liftoff of the first @Commercial_Crew flight test by @SpaceX.

This milestone launch sends the #CrewDragon spacecraft to @Space_Station & provides data toward certification to fly astronauts. Info: https://go.nasa.gov/2IMQOyT pic.twitter.com/HvUCYjuEp6

1109909675410182144.text: Sea ice in the Arctic appears to have reached its annual maximum extent after growing through the fall and winter. Although the 2019 maximum was not a record low, it continued a trend of declining Arctic sea ice. Get more details from @NASA_ICE: https://go.nasa.gov/2FvVhCe pic.twitter.com/9PiixC8JkI

1101898968404033536.text:
Dark and light swirls on our Moon's surface are like "sunburn:" caused by the solar wind's radiation.

1099764150933340163.text: Cracking across Antarctica’s Brunt Ice Shelf is set to release an iceberg w/ an area about 2x the size of NYC. See what @NASAEarth satellites captured: https://go.nasa.gov/2T9iodx pic.twitter.com/WrI1p3bqVC

1105598600627798016.text:
What does the Milky Way weigh?   

New measurements from @NASAHubble and @ESA's Gaia mission find it's at the heavier end of the range for galaxies: its stars, supermassive black hole and dark matter total about 1.5 trillion solar masses. More: https://go.nasa.gov/2J6j3Zn pic.twitter.com/2iBMztHDKO

1113198405356912640.text: .@AstroAnnimal and @Astro_DavidS are going on spacewalk Monday about 8:05am ET. So how long do the life support resources in spacesuits last?pic.twitter.com/0IJjlrzpYl

1111690211262496768.text: Spacewalkers @Astro_Christina and @AstroHague are translating across the truss structure to the Quest airlock. Their they will close the hatch, repressurize the airlock and ingress the station to end today's spacewalk. #AskNASA | https://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/Hu519Xoflx

1072584534074540032.text: Spacewalker Oleg Kononenko begins cutting into the insulation on the Soyuz crew vehicle where a pressure leak was detected and fixed in August. #AskNASA | https://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/I4JMjewB5h

1122942490783506432.text: This morning, teams identified an issue on the station’s electrical power system and are working to identify the root cause and restore full power to the system. There are no immediate concerns for the crew or the station. Info: http://go.nasa.gov/2GHyZwO pic.twitter.com/9S8DQRvIqy

1098346576853037056.text: Save the date! @SpaceX's Demo-1 flight test is scheduled to launch to the space station on March 2. This will be the first time a commercially built and operated American rocket and spacecraft designed for humans will launch to the space station.  Details: https://www.nasa.gov/press-release/nasa-to-provide-coverage-of-spacex-commercial-crew-flight-test …pic.twitter.com/7HCdpNKxSC

1055832673900355584.text: The Expedition 57 Commander got fired up for science this week working on gear that studies flames and gases. Outside the station, a device is making the study of pulsars NICER. #SpaceToGroundpic.twitter.com/JJaYx20OoG

1106354689312845824.text: Beautiful view of the Soyuz vehicle as it approaches just under 15 km of station. Docking set for 9:07pm ET. #AskNASA http://nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/QIPNoni5NO

1109066815064494081.text: .@AstroHague and @AstroAnnimal started their spacewalk today at 8:01am ET to upgrade the station's power storage capacity. https://go.nasa.gov/2umVVeX https://twitter.com/NASA/status/1109061490101899266 …

1087782645918879744.text: .@CSA_ASC astronaut @Astro_DavidS from the station answered Canadian student Adele's question today, "Can you explain how you take photos of Earth from the space station?"pic.twitter.com/vNEUuNOJRV

1064233413605974016.text: Engineering cameras on the Russian cargo craft spot the station about 1 kilometer away. https://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/cuiQacIl2m

1115246811453636608.text: Astronauts @AstroAnnimal and @Astro_DavidS translate on the truss structure working on upgrades to the power systems on the station. #AskNASA | http://nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/dugJRDV2Eo

1062762439610167296.text: On Nov. 20 at 9:50 am CT, we're celebrating our 20th anniversary! Tune in as we ask YOUR questions to the crew in space! Reply with your question or film yourself asking it (landscape-style & in English), then upload to YouTube with #SpaceStation20th in the title by Nov. 16.pic.twitter.com/czMC9OBaCj

1106271184625123329.text: .@al1enbubble wants to know, "Is this going to be the last time using the Soyuz spacecraft?" Keep sending us your questions using #AskNASA http://nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/12Ykd1jPfW

1075576795364118529.text: .@ejmoore915 wants to know, "How long does it take to travel back to Earth?" #AskNASA | https://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/H70iiLVcx5

1058065825243058176.text: This month, we’re celebrating the #SpaceStation20th anniversary! The first element of the station, Zarya, launched atop a Russian Proton rocket on November 20, 1998. The station is now composed of elements and support systems developed around the world. https://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/station/overview/index.html …pic.twitter.com/1qUkB8SuhB

1075567811177504768.text: Three Exp 57 crew members @AstroSerena, @Astro_Alex and Sergey Prokopyev undocked in their Soyuz crew ship at 8:40pm and are heading home due for a 12:03am landing in Kazakhstan. #AskNASA | https://go.nasa.gov/2GtfM4P pic.twitter.com/mk1m26Bj1F

1065364231371911168.text: Are you thawing out your turkey? The space station crew is preparing for Thanksgiving, too! Tomorrow, an American, European and Russian will celebrate together in space with their own special meal. Happy Thanksgiving from the International Space Station!pic.twitter.com/VVW5QEEvKY

1083443785059557381.text: Jakob, a school student from Saskatchewan, Canada, asked @CSA_ASC astronaut @Astro_DavidS on the space station today, "What different roles do astronauts have to be able to fill?" #AskNASApic.twitter.com/Xi6l89cSoY

1062822537082617856.text: Dismal weather pushed back the launch of a U.S. cargo craft to the station one day to Friday. Russia’s resupply ship is still on track for its launch the same day. https://go.nasa.gov/2T8AKIC pic.twitter.com/sAMCzSZ81O

1114165800015933442.text: A Russian cargo ship brought food, fuel and supplies to station this week. Meanwhile, two astronauts get ready to complete the last of three spacewalks to upgrade the batteries on station #SpaceToGroundpic.twitter.com/QuBxuzfdQS

1106358830986752000.text: The Soyuz is less than 50 meters from the space station, as the Exp 59 crew gets closer to their new home. Docking set for 9:07pm ET. #AskNASA http://nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/dezL18j39K

1071373290134859777.text: Once again the @SpaceX #Dragon is heading to its 10 meter capture point as controllers have resolved the communications issue. https://www.nasa.gov/live pic.twitter.com/BoiRXFoZp3
